instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the proposed method in the research that proposed a deep convolutional neural networks (CNN) approach with pure pixel index (PPI) constraints to identify building rooftops materials in remote sensing images, and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the proposed method in the research is the overall accuracy. The overall accuracy measures the percentage of correctly classified samples out of the total number of samples. 

In the research, the proposed method achieved an overall accuracy of 98.83% for the Hyperion dataset and 99.82% for the push-broom hyperspectral imager (PHI) dataset. These high accuracy values indicate that the proposed method is effective in identifying building rooftops materials in remote sensing images.

instruction: Can the proposed CNNP method using spectroscopic data be applied to other frameworks of hyperspectral image classification, based on the results of the study that aimed to improve the classification accuracy in remote sensing images for identifying different building materials?
